intro: Ophrestia lyallii subsp. lyallii, commonly known as the Lyall's ophrestia, is a perennial herb native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are typically covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, which bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky stream banks. Ophrestia lyallii subsp. lyallii is a member of the Apiaceae family, known for its aromatic compounds and often edible plants.
